product_description.product_description: Cement CLC 45 PMES in accordance with the standards NM 10.1.004-2019, NM 10.1.156-2007, NM 10.1.157-2007, NM 10.1.158-2007
product_description.product_application: Used as raw material for the production of concrete and mortar to be used in construction of buildings or public works. Designed to work in seaside and high sulphate content environment.

technical_specifications.test_standard: NM 10.1.005 : Liants hydrauliques : Technique des essais

product_description.substances_reach_svchc: The product does not contain any REACH SVHC substances in amounts greater than 0.1% (1000 ppm).

lca_information.biogenic_carbon_content: There is no biogenic carbon in this product
lca_information.system_boundaries: Cradle to gate scope covering modules A1 (Raw material supply), A2 (Transport), and A3 (Manufacturing).
lca_information.cut_off_criteria: No modules or processes mandatory in EN 15804:2012+A2:2019 and PCR are excluded. No hazardous materials or substances excluded. No neglected unit process more than 1% of total mass or energy flows. Total neglected input and output flows do not exceed 5% of energy usage or mass.

principles: If allocation needed, based on physical properties (mass, volume) when revenue difference is small
If allocation needed, based on economic values

lca_information.averages_and_variability: Values are weighted average of two production sites; variability less than 5%

manufacturing_and_packaging_a1_a3.description: Environmental impacts cover manufacturing of raw materials used in production including clinker, gypsum, limestone, fly ashes, slag, pouzzolana and additives. Packaging material not considered as dispatch is done by truck. Electricity from national network. Water used in closed circuit allocated to clinker production. Waste in cement blending and crushing process recirculated inside factory.

transport_and_installation.notes: Modules A4 and A5 (Transport and installation) not evaluated.

end_of_life.notes: Modules C1-C4 and D not evaluated. Product exempted from declaring these modules as per EN 15804 conditions. End of life scenarios available in EPD for concrete and mortar.

additional_info.health_and_safety: Prolonged physical contact with non-low chromate cements can cause allergic skin reactions. The limit of chromium VI content to be considered as low chromate content is 2 mg/kg.
